title: 111_hr6456
content: The Act is titled the "21st Century Civilian Conservation Corps Act" and establishes the Civilian Conservation Corps. The "21st Century Civilian Conservation Corps Act" establishes a Civilian Conservation Corps to employ citizens in public works projects related to forestation, fire prevention, pest control, and maintenance of public lands. The President may utilize existing Federal departments and agencies to operate the Civilian Conservation Corps for projects related to forestation, fire prevention, pest control, and maintenance of public lands on lands owned by political subdivisions or in private ownership. The President may enter into contracts with States for implementing the Act and acquire real property for projects through various means. SEC. 3. ADMINISTRATION OF CIVILIAN CONSERVATION CORPS. The President shall employ additional persons in the Civilian Conservation Corps in the order of preference: unemployed veterans of the Armed Forces, citizens who have exhausted unemployment compensation, citizens eligible for unemployment compensation, and other citizens seeking employment. The President may provide housing, subsistence, clothing, medical care, and transportation for employees of the Civilian Conservation Corps. Non-discrimination in employment is required, except for individuals convicted of a crime and serving a sentence. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Authorization of Appropriations: The President is authorized $16 billion annually from 2011 to 2014 to establish and run a Civilian Conservation Corps. Unobligated funds for public works can also be used, with at least 80% allocated for employing individuals under this Act, except for certain exceptions. The funds allocated for river and harbor improvements are available until expended. The President's authority to establish and operate a Civilian Conservation Corps under this Act will expire on September 30, 2014.
